definition: train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

sentences.english: It also forced France's express train operator to cut about half of its services.
sentences.chinese: 罢工还迫使法国的高速铁路把车次减半。

sentences.english: Train services have been cut to the bone .
sentences.chinese: 列车车次已大幅度减少。

sentences.english: Train number from following Shanghai to Yongkang.
sentences.chinese: 下面上海到永康的车次时间。

sentences.english: Season- ticket holder will receive a refund if their train is cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 定期车票持有者在其车次被取消时可获得退款。

sentences.english: Is the train for Chicago running often?
sentences.chinese: 去芝加哥的火车车次多吗？

sentences.english: Also, the student ticket booking time for some trains has been advanced.
sentences.chinese: 目前，一些车次学生票的预售期已经提前。

sentences.english: The notice board will tell you which waiting room you need for your train.
sentences.chinese: 公告板上有你要乘坐车次的候车室编号。

sentences.english: Now the presale period of the student tickets for some trains has been advanced.
sentences.chinese: 目前，一些车次学生票的预售期已经提前。
你可以点击这里得到有关车次日程的具体讯息。

definition: grade/class number (in school)/flight or run number/flight or run (seen as an item)/shift (work period)
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
(of trains etc) to set off (on a journey)/to start (being issued or circulated)/to start (happening)/originating
bus or tram stop/intermediate stop (on route of ship, plane etc)/port of call/stopover
(physics) magnetic reconnection/(railways) double heading (using two locomotives at the front of a train)
